Introducing the Avola Slip Dress & Top, this month's #CashmeretteClub pattern! 🎉🎉🎉

If you're curvy, it's nearly impossible to find a ready-to-wear cami or strappy dress that actually fits. With all of the gaping in the neckline and around the armholes, you're either forced to cover up with a topper or show your entire bra to the whole world. But all that changes today thanks to the Avola!

So slip on the Avola Slip Dress & Top anytime–day or night! With bust darts and a center back seam for shaping through the bust and waist plus two strap options, the Avola is sure to fill all manner of gaps in your wardrobe (without any gaping). Make a slinky slip, a strappy dress, a traditional camisole, a casual tank, or a sophisticated nightgown–all with this single pattern.

The #AvolaDress and #AvolaTop comes in sizes 0-32 and cup sizes C-H. It's designed for straight grain but can be cut on the bias if you prefer.

This pattern is available exclusively to Cashmerette Club members. Not a member yet? Join today for as little as $9 USD—cancel anytime. Head to cashmerette.com/club to get started.

#Cashmerette #CashmerettePatterns #PlusSizeSewing #CurvySewing #ISew #Sewing #HandmadeWardrobe #IndiePatterns #SewistsOfInstagram #SewersOfInstagram #MeMade

Jan Marie is wearing an aqua Avola Dress and standing next to the chair with one hand on her chair back. Next to the image on a navy background is the text: "Avola Slip Dress & Top".

Image 2 description: Technical illustration of the Avola Slip Dress and Top on a white background.]

This month's #CashmeretteClub pattern is the Avola Slip Dress & Top! With this single pattern, you can make a slinky slip, a strappy dress, a traditional camisole, a casual tank, or a sophisticated nightgown.

This pattern features:
- Bust-friendly design with bust darts and cup sizes C-H
- Center back seam for waist shaping
- Delicate V-shaped neckline
- Two hem lengths: a knee-length dress or a top that hits at high hip
- Full lining for the top and half lining for the dress
- Two strap options: wide fixed straps that cover your bra or narrow adjustable straps with rings and sliders

Jenny is wearing an Avola Dress in a size 18 G/H. Her measurements are 44" high bust, 49" full bust, 42" waist, and 46" hip, and she is 5' 6".

Start the new year with a beautiful, supportive bra that you made yourself!

Our friends at @nelliejoans have added a brand new #WillowdaleBra kit just in time for the holidays. Take the hassle out of sourcing bra supplies and gift yourself a gorgeous all-in-one bra kit. Swing over to their shop to see this kit plus 7 others!

Nellie Joans Lingerie Findings is a sewing supplies shop for all things bra making plus briefs, swimwear and activewear! You can shop online or in-store at their boutique shop in the heart of Taranaki, NZ.

The Willowdale Bra is an underwire bra sewing pattern for big boobs in band sizes 28-54 and cup sizes C-J with a 4-piece cup design for vital support and lift in a beautifully rounded shape.

If you have big boobs, you've probably given up on buying ready-to-wear camisoles or strappy dresses. They always gape in the neckline and around the armhole, and show your bra off to the whole world. You may have even had the same experience when you've sewn your own strappy tank because most sewing patterns are drafted for a B cup bust.

But all of that changes now thanks to the bust-friendly Avola Slip Dress & Top. Say goodbye to gaping and hello to a wardrobe essential that you can make and wear in so many ways. 

The #AvolaDress and #AvolaTop is this month's #CashmeretteClub pattern and comes in sizes 0-32 and cup sizes C-H. Join today to get this pattern for as little as $9/month at cashmerette.com/club.

This month, Jenny is diving into asymmetry. Sewing patterns assume that your body is symmetrical, but what if it isn't? How do you adjust patterns to balance or fit the differences between your two sides? Jenny shares her best tips for addressing asymmetry in a variety of garments.

・・・
There's something about those 'make it work' moments. I knew that I wanted to make a t-shirt dress from the Concord Tee by Cashmerette. My plan with this fabric was a vertical striped, extended t-shirt, but I only had 1.6m. No matter how I tried to pattern Tetris it out (and I really tried), it was not going to happen. Instead of letting that defeat me, I had to re-think my plan and listen to my inner Tim Gunn to 'make it work'.

If something doesn't fit you, it's the fault of the clothes. Period. Full stop. 

Your body is never the issue—the pattern is. Anything to do with clothes and fitting can be an emotional minefield, but if you can, try to keep that in mind while sewing your clothes. 

My book, #AheadOfTheCurve, is the body-positive fitting manual we all deserve. Check it out in the Cashmerette shop and get ready to sew the well-fitting wardrobe of your dreams.

#Cashmerette #CashmerettePatterns #PlusSizeSewing #CurvySewing #ISew #Sewing #HandmadeWardrobe #IndiePatterns #SewistsOfInstagram #SewersOfInstagram #MeMade

Here’s a true fact: it’s literally impossible for me to buy a ready-made blazer that fits. And if I want a high quality blazer, made with gorgeous fabrics and proper tailoring inside? Forget about it!

Which is why my first proper #AuburnBlazer has been such a joy to wear. Designing this sewing pattern and being able to sew it in whatever fabrics I choose means for the very first time in my life I have a luxurious, well-made blazer that fits all of me. Not having to compromise with boxiness, or huge shoulders, but actually fit each part of me properly!

#Cashmerette #CashmerettePatterns #PlusSizeSewing #CurvySewing #ISew #Sewing #HandmadeWardrobe #IndiePatterns #SewistsOfInstagram #SewersOfInstagram #MeMade

Close your eyes and imagine for a second: how would it feel to have pants that actually fit? Sure, the act of wearing those pants would feel great, but the best part would be that you would be free to stop thinking about your pants! When clothing fits us well, we can go about our life without being uncomfortable or having to constantly adjust things this way or that way—and that is truly liberating.

Learn to fit your own pants with the #MagnaPants, a beginner-friendly pants sewing pattern included with Jenny's new book #AheadOfTheCurve. 

#Cashmerette #CashmerettePatterns #PlusSizeSewing #CurvySewing #ISew #Sewing #HandmadeWardrobe #IndiePatterns #SewistsOfInstagram #SewersOfInstagram #MeMade 

[Image description: Dibs wearing an orange Stanway T-Shirt and green and orange print Magna Pants. She's standing with her side to the camera in front of a light gray wall and a cactus plant.]

I often find myself wanting a top that’s as comfortable as a t-shirt but a bit more sophisticated. That's why we designed the #DartmouthTop, and it continues to be my go-to elevated tee. (To be perfectly truthful, many of our designs come about because of gaps in my wardrobe!) What I love the most about my Dartmouths is that I don't have to wear camis underneath—we've designed them so that they don't gape in the front, even if you have H cup boobs like moi.

#Cashmerette #CashmerettePatterns #PlusSizeSewing #CurvySewing #ISew #Sewing #HandmadeWardrobe #IndiePatterns #SewistsOfInstagram #SewersOfInstagram #MeMade

When you're starting out with sewing your own clothes, it can be hard to know what size to make. That's why we created the Cashmerette Size Calculator! Simply enter your high bust, full bust, waist, and hip measurements as well as your typical bra cup size, and you'll instantly see your ideal starting size for Cashmerette patterns. We'll even tell you if you should grade between sizes or do an FBA or SBA! Go to cashmerette.com/sizing to try it for yourself.

#Cashmerette #CashmerettePatterns #PlusSizeSewing #CurvySewing #ISew #Sewing #HandmadeWardrobe #IndiePatterns #SewistsOfInstagram #SewersOfInstagram #MeMade

If you're curvy, it's nearly impossible to find a ready-to-wear cami or strappy dress that actually fits. With all of the gaping in the neckline and around the armholes, you're either forced to cover up with a topper or show your entire bra to the whole world. But all that changes now thanks to the Avola Slip Dress & Top, this month's #CashmeretteClub pattern!

With bust darts and a center back seam for shaping through the bust and waist plus two strap options, the Avola is sure to fill all manner of gaps in your wardrobe (without any gaping). Make a slinky slip, a strappy dress, a traditional camisole, a casual tank, or a sophisticated nightgown–all with this single pattern.

The #AvolaDress and #AvolaTop comes in sizes 0-32 and cup sizes C-H. It's designed for straight grain but can be cut on the bias if you prefer.

8th century Rococo vibes using #roseclairdress by #cashmerettepatterns as my entry into the #sewwrapped challenge.

This month’s #CashmeretteClub pattern, the Murcot Puffer Vest, is designed for light-to mid-weight non-stretch woven fabric such as cotton, woven polyester, or nylon. 

The lining can be made with a lightweight non-stretch fabric and the batting should be a high loft batting approximately ½” thick, such as 6 oz polyester batting, Quilters Dream Puff, or wool (standard cotton batting will not provide enough loft for the puffer look).

Oui! Oui! Christine’s dazzling red #UptonDress was the star of the show during her recent once-in-a-lifetime trip to Paris. And we have to say she nailed this look. Click through to her profile to read the story behind this red Upton twirling dream ❤️❤️
 
#Repost @cdcrjck 
…
I decided, as one does, that I NEEDED a red dress mere days before a big trip last month, and boy am I glad I did! This heavily hacked @cashmerette Upton Dress was the star of the show at a once-in-a-lifetime photo shoot a couple weeks ago. ❤️💃🏻🇫🇷 I mashed the Upton expansion pack bodice (scoop neck, 3/4 sleeves) with the Gilmore skirt, rotated the bodice darts up to the neckline, added a full lining, and added horsehair braid to the hem. I didn’t have time for a toile, so the fit isn’t perfect, and it needs a really good press — I finished the hem the night before in the hotel room — but I couldn’t be more pleased with how it turned out. Red wool crepe and silk charmeuse lining from @nydesignerfabric thanks to their excellent customer service and lightning-fast shipping. Gorgeous handwoven shawl is by @mamamokum

-A bust-friendly design with shoulder princess seams and cup sizes C-H
-Warm puffer outer layer created by quilting the main fabric to batting
-Full lining for a clean inside finish
-Collar that stands up and keeps your neck warm
-Snap closures
-Optional puffy welt pockets to keep your hands warm and store all your stuff

The #MurcotVest comes in sizes 0-32 and cup sizes C-H and is available exclusively to Cashmerette Club members.

Hi! It’s been a bit. My making hasn’t slowed, but my documentation of it has. Here is a latergram of me just casually walking around Joshua Tree feeling like a goddess! This is the #cashmerettepatterns #rockwelldress in a @moodfabrics #marcjacobs silk blend that I made as a special occasion dress for, you know, special occasions. This is part of the #cashmeretteclub and I didn’t need to make one adjustment. Can you imagine?! Per Cashmerette, The Rockwell is inspired by the groundbreaking creations of fashion designer Claire McCardell in the late 1940s. The Rockwell has a tightly gathered neckline with front tie and slit and is gathered under the bust with a waist tie that wraps around the torso. I followed the instructions for a free flowing back by tying the back waist on the inside through a side slit. This was a versatile and comfortable make.
 
A big thanks to @hildeekat for being a great photog, @janelissimo for being an excellent t hype woman and Joshua Tree for the epic scenery.

This month’s #CashmeretteClub pattern, the Elmwood Skirt is designed for mid-weight woven fabric such as wool suiting, linen, poly/cotton, or poly/wool blend. Stretch woven fabric may also be used—look for a midweight fabric with 2-way stretch (not 4-way) such as stretch suiting or a stable ponte.

Line your Elmwood with lightweight lining fabric such as rayon Bemberg. If you’re using a stretch woven, use a lining with the same amount of stretch.

It's here, and you can get it FREE! 🎉🎉🎉 Introducing the Canton Moto Jacket, a classic moto jacket designed for curves.

The motorcycle jacket has been a popular style for decades, but if you have big boobs, you've likely never found one that actually fit. With ready-to-wear moto jackets, you're forced to choose between squashing your bust, only wearing it open, or having it fit your bust but fall off your shoulders. But all of that changes today!

Say hello to the #CantonJacket, the newest pattern to join the Cashmerette lineup. The Canton is designed for curves with sizes 0-32 and cup sizes C-H, princess seams, back fisheye darts, and two-piece sleeves with a full bicep option—and of course, the classic biker-style details that make this a timeless piece for your wardrobe.

The Canton is available to all to purchase as a PDF or printed pattern—no need to be a Club member. But you can get the Canton PDF pattern FREE when you join Cashmerette Club at the All Access level by March 31st! Head to cashmerette.com/club to get started.

Already an All Access member? Head to the Club dashboard for the coupon code.

Rev up your wardrobe with the new Canton Moto Jacket! 🏍 🏍

Designed for curves with all the details you love in a motorcycle jacket, the #CantonJacket features:
👉 Sizes 0-32 and cup sizes C-H for a fabulous bust fit
👉 Front princess seams
👉 Back fisheye darts for shaping
👉 Asymmetrical front zip
👉 Two views: View A is hip length with zipper pockets while View B is cropped with no pockets
👉 Wide notched lapel
👉 Lined interior
👉 Two-piece sleeves with sophisticated gusseted zipper sleeve openings
👉 A full bicep sleeve option in sizes 12-32
👉 Optional large snaps

The Canton Moto Jacket pattern is rated intermediate, and thanks to our free step-by-step video sewalong (hosted by the fabulous Whitney @tomkatstitcherycarmel), you can sew your first Canton with confidence! 

The Canton is available as an instant download PDF that you can print at home or at a copyshop, or you can pre-order the Canton printed pattern and we'll gladly ship it anywhere in the world. (Expected to ship in April) Get your copy at cashmerette.com/canton.

Our newest pattern, the Canton Moto Jacket, is designed for mid- to heavy-weight woven fabrics such as boiled wool, boucle, jacquard, denim, vinyl, or leather. Want a bit of give in your jacket? Low-stretch woven fabrics will also work!

There are so many fun fabric options when it comes to creating the Canton Moto Jacket of your dreams. 

This timeless moto jacket is designed for mid- to heavy-weight woven fabrics such as boiled wool, boucle, jacquard, denim, vinyl, or leather. Low-stretch woven fabrics can work too. And for the lining, you'll want to use a lightweight woven fabric such as rayon Bemberg or crepe de chine.

One of the best things about making sewing patterns that fit plus size, busty sewists really well is seeing people choosing to wear them at seminal moments in their life. We've seen a number of wedding dresses come through our feed, but this was a first: an #UptonDress at the Oscars!

Jeanette's son was recently nominated for an Oscar and invited her to join him at the award show as his guest. Here's what Jeanette told us happened next:
"Suddenly, I needed a dress. I knew that I wanted it to be appropriate for the occasion, not too flashy (because that's just not me), comfortable, have sleeves, and something that I could wear a regular bra under. Cashmerette Upton to the rescue!"

Shopping for an event like this can be a total nightmare if you're curvy or plus size. So it makes us absolutely elated to know that Jeanette was able to create her perfect Oscars dress and celebrate her son's incredible achievements while looking fabulous in a gown she made herself. And how many Oscars attendees can say that they made their own outfit?!

If you've never had a moto jacket that fits, you might not know what your moto style is. 🤷🏽

We're here to help you figure it out and find fabric for your first Canton! Today on the blog, we're sharing an array of our favorite fabric ideas for the #CantonJacket available right now. Head on over to the link in our profile for tons of fabric inspiration!

The Canton is designed for mid- to heavy-weight woven fabrics such as boiled wool, boucle, jacquard, denim, vinyl, or leather. Low-stretch woven fabrics will also work. For the lining, you’ll want to use a lightweight woven fabric such as rayon Bemberg or crepe de chine.

Samantha (@samanthapopecreations) loved the Brattle so much that she made 4 different versions! Each version is unique in its own way and truly demonstrates how you can take this pattern and create a variety of looks that will add dimension and depth to any wardrobe.

Brattle #1: Samantha’s autumn Brattle was made from a patterned lurex found in her stash. She sewed it in a size 18 and added a self drafted cowl drape neckline.

Brattle #2: Samantha’s silver Brattle is a shimmery dream. She added the Tobin Sweater collar and sleeves and used a foiled knit fabric from her stash. She sewed a size 18 and graded out to a 22 on the bottom.

Brattle #3: Samantha’s red Brattle was a test run for the silver version but has absolutely fallen in love with it even though she normally never wears red! Once again she added the Tobin Sweater collar and sleeves and used a firm knit from her stash. She sewed a size 18 on the top half and graded out to a 22 on the bottom.

Brattle #4: Samantha’s mint and lavender Brattle is brilliantly color blocked by adding seams in the center front and center back and is part of her PJ coordinates. She sewed a size 18.
 
Samantha’s measurements are 43.5” high bust, 56.5” full bust, 41” waist, and 47.5” hips.

Samantha’s neon leopard print rayon is fierce in all the right ways. But the best part? The fabulous scallop neckline! 😍 

With the most unique and personalized touches, Samantha’s Hampden is extraordinary and a wonderful reminder that you can make this and every Cashmerette pattern whatever you want it to be. She also loved the fact that you can put it on by simply popping it over your head no matter what your cup size. And don’t forget about the side seam pockets and swishy skirt! 

Samantha (@samanthapopecreations) sewed a size 20 G/H and chose the Hampden bodice and Holyoke skirt but cut to the Hampden skirt length. Her measurements are 44” high bust, 47.5” full bust, 41” waist, and 47.5” hips.

“I added a scallop neckline detail by cutting bias strips from my fabric and sewing these into 9mm roulea tubes. I cut these into 2″ lengths and using wash out glue, stuck them to paper in a curved interwoven design. I stitched through the paper to hold the tubes together then ripped them away and applied them to the neckline. See my blog for more details.”

Her measurements are 44” high bust, 47.5” full bust, 41” waist, and 47.5” hips.

Samantha shared this about her leopard print Hampden Dress:
“I really like the Hampden bodice with the Holyoke skirt as I prefer a fuller swishy skirt with side seam pockets! Also the fact that the front is sewn together and you can just pop it on over your head, even with a G cup bust, is genius!”

Sewn in a 14 E/F using a floral viscose linen, Anastacia mixed and matched the Hampden and the Holyoke to create a fabulous fitting and free flowing full-length sundress. This was her first handmade maxi and with the princess seam and the elasticated waistband, it sounds like it won’t be her last comfortable and curve-friendly Hampden. 

Anastacia’s (@tjs_styles) measurements are 39” high bust, 43” full bust, 36” waist, and 48” hips.

Anastacia shared this about her Hampden Dress:
“What a beautiful pattern!!! I made a mash-up of Hampden and Holyoke in size 14 based on the finished measurement. I love the free flow of the Holyoke and the fit of the finished garment is incredible 🥰🥰🥰. The instructions are really clear and easy to follow, I had no issues at all. This is my first maxi handmade dress as I normally sew midi length… I love everything about the pattern from the princess seam (which makes it easy to fit) to the elasticated back waist (which cinches in the waist) to the amazing full length of Holyoke.”

The Hampden Dress comes in sizes 0-32 and cup sizes C-H and is available exclusively to Cashmerette Club members. Not a member yet? Join today for as little as $9 USD—cancel anytime. Get started at cashmerette.com/club.

With the Hampden you can expand your sundress collection even more by mixing and matching the Hampden with the Holyoke Maxi Dress & Skirt! 

The Hampden includes a sleeved bodice, knee-length skirt, and patch pockets, but you can swap any of these features out for the Holyoke’s sleeveless bodice, maxi-length skirt, and inseam pockets. You can also use the Holyoke’s skirt waistband to make a standalone Hampden skirt.

Kelly (@thingskellymade) sewed hers in a size 6 C/D with a 1″ SBA graded to an 8 waist. Her measurements are 33” high bust, 34.5” full bust, 28” waist, and 40” hips.

“My favourite thing about the Hampden dress is the elastic back waistband. It gives the dress a gorgeous shape while being really comfortable. And its addition means that the button placket doesn’t need to be functional. I will always avoid a buttonhole if possible!”

Her first Hampden was sewn in a pink lightweight linen giving it a classic and summery vibe. With pink pockets, fitted princess seams, and the fitted knee length skirt, this dress could easily serve as a layering piece at the office or the perfect outfit for a casual summer outing.

I love the pink pockets with the fitted princess seams and fitted knee length skirt. With this version, I chose to sew a faux button placket. I’ve noticed that my fitting skills have improved so much with Cashmerette patterns and the sizing calculator.”

I love the flattering princess seams in the back and front and the very clever elastic back waistband takes all of the hard work out of fitting my curves whilst also being extremely comfortable. I can see many more Hampden dresses in my future.”

Emily loved making a classic version of the Hampden Dress so much that she made a second version in a rayon fabric complete with a Holyoke skirt. Soft, drapey, and with the functional button placket, not only is this version breezy and beautiful, but also incredibly comfortable.

This time, I made the button placket functional and ironically, with the softer, drapier rayon fabric, it pulls over my head and bust effortlessly. I probably should have considered the faux placket for this version and the functional placket for the sturdier linen fabric.”

You’re cordially invited to an Upton wedding dress love story ❤️

When Jane chose our Upton pattern to create her perfectly personalized wedding dress we were absolutely honored. It means the world to us when people use our patterns for the big occasions in their lives and we can’t think of a more important and celebrated occasion than somebody’s wedding day! 

Equipped with a pattern, fabric and some sketches, she turned her DIY dreams into a dazzling gold dress fit for a glowing bride. 

Hop on over to our blog and follow along with Jane’s journey from original sketches to the dazzling finished product.

I made this for Frocktails last year in the frantic days before I moved interstate and just unpacked it again on the weekend. It’s a dress that lends itself to striding confidently into the wind on a whimsical mission and is by far one of the most favourite things I have ever made 🧡💖

Through my exciting collaboration with Cashmerette, I made this very cute dress hack of the Selwyn top, which is June’s club pattern!

Here’s what I did: I took my size B14-W16-H16 graded Selwyn and lengthened the dress by 18” in the front and 22” in the back for a comfortable wheelchair cut (you wouldn’t know if I didn’t tell you 😉). I lengthened the pintucks allll the way to the bottom and the button placket too, for a total of 14 buttons. I also made the skirt a straightish  a-line from the waist to the hem instead of very curvy. Oh, and I added a pintuck at the back waist for visual interest. And there you have it!! 

Made in a cotton single gauze that is very comfortable in summer (bought at @fabricville ).

I am also wearing a self drafted sun visor that I made last summer.

Imagine this: you’re sitting in a meeting at work but you can’t concentrate on what’s being said because you’re worried your blouse is gaping open.🤦🏽‍♀️

If you have a big bust, that’s probably not very hard to imagine—you’re likely very familiar with that feeling! When you have big boobs, button-up blouses that fit your curves and don’t gape at your bust are quite hard to come by, and it’s one reason why many of us turn to sewing. But most sewing patterns are drafted for smaller cup sizes, so those often don’t fit either.

So say goodbye to gaping and hello to your new favorite blouse with the Selwyn Top, this month’s Cashmerette Club pattern!

We're looking for fit models in sizes 18-22 in the Greater Boston and Metrowest area! 

What is a fit model? Fit models try on draft samples early on in the development process to help us identify adjustments that need to be made before a pattern goes to testing.

Fit models receive financial compensation for each fitting session, and no sewing knowledge or experience is required. No modeling experience is necessary either: all you need to know is how to put on and wear clothes.

We're looking for fit models in these sizes:

The size 18 model must have these measurements:
-High bust: 43″
-Full bust: 47-48″
-Waist: 38″
-Hip: 48″

The size 20 model must have these measurements:
-High bust: 45″
-Full bust: 49-50″
-Waist: 40″
-Hip: 50″

The size 22 model must have these measurements:
-High bust: 47″
-Full bust: 51-52″
-Waist: 42″
-Hip: 52″

All fit models must:
-Be between 5′ 5″ and 5’ 7″ tall
-Wear a bra cup size of at least DDD/F

(Not sure how to take your measurements? See our guide at cashmerette.com/measurements)

If you or someone you know is interested in being a Cashmerette fit model, email us at hello@cashmerette.com with your (or their) measurements and a few recent photos. We'll be in touch from there!

This month’s Cashmerette Club pattern is the Franconia Dress, a shirred woven dress designed for curves! The Franconia is a lightweight woven dress with a shirred waistband for all-day comfort, a gape-free faux button placket, a delicate bound v-neckline and essential inseam pockets. 

Sew yours up for an easy breezy everyday look or a stylish beach cover-up!

The Franconia Dress is designed for a loose fit with a cinched waist. If you'd like a more fitted look, go down one size.

I did it again! 📚📖✍️ My second book, “Sewing the Curve: Learn How to Sew Clothes to Boost Your Wardrobe and Your Confidence” is coming your way in November! 

‼️Click the link in our profile to see pre-order options in your country.‼️

I had so much fun writing my first book, “Ahead of the Curve”, and it had such a fabulous reception that I decided to give this book-writing thing another whirl. And this time, I focused on a sorely underserved part of the sewing world: plus-size beginner sewists.”Sewing the Curve” is a guide to learning to sew for plus size sewings, complete with 6 brand new patterns (!!) in sizes 12-32 and cup sizes C-H—including some designs that Cashmerette fans have been asking for for years:
✅ Breezy woven swing dress and tunic
✅ Cool asymmetrical wrap skirt,
✅ T-shirt with multiple sleeve options
✅ Snazzy knit pants
✅ Bust-friendly darted quilted jacket
✅ Gorgeous lined sheath dress

I’ll be sharing more about how I wrote “Sewing the Curve,” as well as details on all of those amazing sewing patterns, over the next few weeks and months. In the meantime, if you’re interested, please do pre-order—it makes a huge difference to the support we get from bookstores when they see people enthusiastic to order, so it means a lot! Click the link in our profile to see pre-order options.

And if it’s not for you, maybe there’s an aspiring or beginner sewists in your life that might be interested, so consider sharing the word!

But my favorite part was swanning around the toe of Italy wearing my Cashmerette Club Franconia Dress! 

My all-time favorite Cashmerette Club pattern, the Franconia is a lightweight woven dress with a shirred waistband for all-day comfort, a gape-free faux button placket, a delicate bound v-neckline and essential inseam pockets.

I really loved the comfort of the shaping without being super fitted and the super soft lovely gingham double gauze generous donated to us by @atelierbrunette 😍

In “Sewing the Curve,” I cover everything from the very basics, like how to choose a sewing machine, how to understand sizing, where to find plus-size friendly patterns, and how to use printed and PDF patterns, through to the five core skills of sewing, and then, how to actually sew your first garments. Highlights include:
👉6 brand new Cashmerette patterns, including a woven swing dress and tunic, a really cool wrap skirt, an awesome t-shirt, snazzy knit pants, a bust-friendly darted quilted jacket, and a gorgeous lined sheath dress. Even if you’re not a beginner, the book is a total bargain for the patterns alone, which are worth over $130!
👉Photographic step-by-step tutorials on all the key skills you need to learn when you’re sewing
👉Tons of videos to accompany the tutorials, and full sewalongs of each pattern! 
👉An encouraging, body neutral-to-positive tone that will have you excited to sew. So many sewing books can weirdly make you feel bad about yourself, whether it’s direct or more subtle, like only using very small models, or never referring to anything above a size 12. Not here! This book is exclusively tailored for plus size sewists.
👉GORGEOUS MODELS THROUGHOUT. Including some familiar faces! I find there’s nothing quite as inspiring as seeing garments on bodies like mine.

Learn to sew your own clothes! My new book, "Sewing the Curve," is available to pre-order now. (Link in our profile)

When I learned to sew a decade ago, I bought a popular sewing book, along with some fabric, tools, and a sewing machine. And then discovered to my dismay that none of the patterns came in my size, despite the fact I was a totally average size. I ended up making a wrap skirt which would *sort of* fit, though it was definitely not trustworthy on a windy day, and eventually I had to learn how to adjust sewing patterns in order to actually make truly wearable garments.

So I know all too well how disheartening it is to be learning to sew and not have patterns or instructions that actually include you, or to have to do tons of *extra* work to achieve the same result.

Although the overall state of the plus size sewing market has improved radically since then, I realized there still wasn’t a “learn to sew” book out there for plus size people: and thus, “Sewing the Curve” was born!

”Sewing the Curve” is a guide to learning to sew for plus size sewists, complete with 6 brand new Cashmerette patterns in sizes 12-32 and cup sizes C-H, including a woven swing dress and tunic, asymmetrical wrap skirt, t-shirt, knit pants, quilted jacket, and lined sheath dress.

Pre-order your signed copy at cashmerette.com/stc.

I’m so excited to introduce the first pattern from my upcoming book, “Sewing the Curve”: the Montvale Dress & Tunic! 🤩

“Sewing the Curve” is a beginner’s guide to sewing for plus size sewists, and it includes 6 (yup, six!!) brand-new patterns in sizes 12-32 and cup sizes C-H. The printed patterns are included in a packet at the back of the book, or you can download the digital PDF patterns and print them at home or at a copyshop. 

And the Montvale is the perfect first garment sewing project—a swooshy swing dress or tunic, with darts and a neckline facing, that you’ll be able to tackle with confidence!

Make the View A dress and learn how to insert side-seam pockets and finish sleeveless armholes with a bias facing (a type of bias binding). Or if you want to start with the simplest possible pattern, try the View B tunic, which has “drop” sleeves that are integrated into the main bodice without a separate seam. They’re the easiest type of sleeve to sew, and stylish to boot! Plus, you can mix-and-match the different sleeves and lengths to make the custom garment you want.

“Sewing the Curve” is coming in November! Pre-order your copy at cashmerette.com/SewingTheCurve

Why learn to sew? 🤔

Learning to sew your own clothes at any size opens a world of wardrobe possibilities, but that's especially true if you're plus size.

Plus size options in ready-to-wear shops are still very limited, so if you don't know how to sew, you're limited to what styles, prints, and fabrics the fashion brands think you should wear. Well, we say: enough!

When you learn to sew your own clothes, you're able to make and wear exactly what you want in whatever color or print you want—and have it fit you fabulously! That means that you'll feel more like yourself, be able to project the image you want out to the world, and feel the most confident you've ever felt in your life.

Non-stretch jeans that are actually comfortable?! You heard it right, folks!

What makes the Creston Jeans so comfortable is our innovative flex waistband that gives you 3-4 inches of extra room when you sit down!

Non-stretch jeans can be pretty uncomfortable if your waist and tummy spreads when you sit down—and whose doesn’t? Often your only options are to either make the jeans in a bigger size (and then they slip when you’re standing up) or to use a visible elastic waistband. And while we love a good visible elastic waistband, it isn’t always the look you want.

So we’ve devised a flexible waistband that allows the waist of the Creston Jeans to expand as you sit down. And it’s totally hidden for a clean finish that doesn’t take away from the traditional jeans look.

The Creston Jeans sewing pattern comes in sizes 0-32 and is available exclusively to Cashmerette Club members. Not a member yet? Join today for as little as $9 USD—cancel anytime. Get started at cashmerette.com/club.

This chic and easy-to-wear woven wrap skirt was inspired by my very first experience sewing a wrap skirt. What makes the Creston Jeans so comfortable? A flex waistband that gives you 3-4 inches of extra room when you sit down!

Non-stretch jeans can be pretty uncomfortable if your waist and tummy spreads when you sit down—and whose doesn’t? Often your only options are to either make the jeans in a bigger size (and then they slip when you’re standing up) or to use a visible elastic waistband. And while we love a good visible elastic waistband, it isn’t always the look you want.

So we’ve devised a flexible waistband that allows the waist of the Creston Jeans to expand as you sit down. And it’s totally hidden for a clean finish that doesn’t take away from the traditional jeans look.

The fabric, the drape, the fit - everything is divine when it comes to Lilli’s #StanwayTShirt. She utilized a fabric that she had been eyeing for quite some time and was able to sew up a Stanway that was smooth, accommodating and fit like a glove. 

#Repost @frocksandfroufrou with @get.repost
・・・
When I was a little girl my mum used to sew clothes for my siblings and I, and I still remember the reverence with which she spoke about Liberty fabrics. The quality of the fabric and distinctive prints set it well above your run-of-the-mill yardage. 

The modern Liberty Print is every bit as luxe as the Liberty of my childhood, but includes some very cool prints, like this “Sketch” print of scattered pencils, which has been printed on a gloriously soft viscose jersey. 

This is the #stanwaytshirt from @cashmerette’s book Ahead of the Curve, and it fit me like a glove, right out of the packet. 

It’s quite long in the body,I nipped-in curve at the waist but plenty of room at the hips. The raglan sleeves are a comfortable width that’s neither baggy nor tight (I added the cuffs myself for fun). Most impressive though is that the cut on the front accomodates my g-cups comfortably, while the back skims the shape of my body with a smooth line. (Allow me to assure you that underneath this tee my back is anything but smooth.)

The fabric is divinely soft, and has a lovely drape to it. As a viscose knit it’s quite thin, but never sheer. I managed to sew the neckband on back to front - with a finishing line of double stitches and everything -  and once I finished cursing myself and went to work with my seam-ripper I was genuinely surprised to discover that unpicking three (3!) whole-ass lines of stitching didn’t stretch the neckline beyond redemption; the recovery of the stretch was light years ahead of any other viscose jersey I’ve ever worked with.

This month’s #CashmeretteClub pattern is the Catskills Jacket, a vintage-style bias-cut topper inspired by Claire McCardell. Unlined and finished with sophisticated French seams, the Catskills Jacket features a gorgeous drape, French darts, and grown-on sleeves in three lengths.

The Catskills Jacket is designed for light- to medium-weight wovens or stable knits such as wool suiting, boiled wool, wool jersey, linen, or chambray. We know you love options—that’s one of the reasons why our Upton Dress & Skirt plus Mix & Match Expansion is our most popular pattern. (That and the fabulous fit for curves, if we do say so ourselves.) 

Well, we wanted to offer the same choose-your-own-adventure pack for knits this time. 

Enter the brand-new Grafton Dress, Top and Skirt Mix & Match Pack, a knit mix and match sewing pattern featuring over 400 possible garment combinations!

This Mix & Match Pack features multiple bodice, skirt, sleeve, and neckline options to make over 400 possible knit dresses, tops, and skirts. Whether you’re in the mood for a casual skater dress, a trendy asymmetrical skirt, a glamorous gown, an elevated tee, or a retro frock, you can choose your own adventure and create a beautifully customized creation every time you sew the Grafton. 

Are you ready to start making your first Grafton? Then let’s get sewing! And don’t forget, you can pre-order the Grafton Dress, Top & Skirt printed pattern and you’ll get the Grafton PDF pattern for free, instantly! Head to cashmerette.com/grafton to learn more.

And Jan Marie is wearing a green asymmetric Grafton Skirt with a white tank top and chunky black boots. They’re all standing arm in arm and laughing together.]

This curve-friendly knit pattern comes in our two size ranges, 0-16 and 12-32 (sold separately) and in cup sizes C-H and can basically do it all. Whether you’re on the hunt for a new going-out top, floral maxi skirt, or matching set for dinner at your favorite restaurant, you can choose your own adventure every time you sew the Grafton Dress, Top and Skirt Mix & Match Pack.

It’s our first ever jumpsuit! 

This month’s Cashmerette Club pattern is the Mercier Jumpsuit. The Mercier is a stylish knit jumpsuit with a wrap top, waist darts for shaping, straight-leg pants with an elasticated back waistband, and short sleeves. The wrap’s overlayer opens in the front to make the jumpsuit easy to get on and off, while tying securely at the waist when worn. 

Whether sewn up in a soft jersey for an everyday look or in a metallic knit for a dramatic showstopper, the Mercier will take your wardrobe to the next level.

Want even more options? Mix and match the Mercier with the new Grafton Dress, Top & Skirt’s sleeves and skirts to create over two dozen additional looks! 

The Mercier comes in sizes 0-32 and cup sizes C-H and is available exclusively to Cashmerette Club members. Not a member yet? Join today for as little as $9 (cancel anytime). Get started at cashmerette.com/club.

#MercierJumpsuit #Cashmerette #CashmerettePatterns #PlusSizeSewing #CurvySewing #ISew #Sewing #HandmadeWardrobe #IndiePatterns #SewistsOfInstagram #SewersOfInstagram #MeMade

Jumpstart your new style with the Mercier! Designed for curves, comfort, and style, the Mercier features:
🕺 A wrap top in cup sizes C-H with waist darts for shaping: the underlayer of the wrap is sewn to the front waistband, while the overlayer is only attached at the side seam to create a big opening for easy access in and out of the jumpsuit.
🕺 A neckband and ties to secure the wrap when worn—no gaping here!
🕺 Short sleeves, or use the straight or bishop sleeves from the Grafton Mix & Match Pack
🕺 Straight-leg pants with an elasticated back waistband that makes it easier to pull the pants over your hips
🕺 Optional slash pockets
🕺 Prefer a dress over a jumpsuit? Pair the Mercier’s wrap top with any of the skirts from the Grafton Mix & Match Pack

The Mercier comes in sizes 0-32 and cup sizes C-H and is available exclusively to Cashmerette Club members. Not a member yet? Join today for as little as $9 (cancel anytime). Get started at cashmerette.com/club.

The Mercier is designed for light- to mid-weight knit fabrics such as jersey, ITY, Liverpool knit, double knit, or ponte with at least 25% stretch horizontally and 10% stretch vertically.

Jumpsuits have been super trendy for a few years now, but if you’re curvy, it can be hard to find a jumpsuit that fits you well in all the places. Until now.

Meet the Mercier Jumpsuit, the Cashmerette Club pattern for October.

Skip the gaping neckline, the too-high crotch, and the too-long legs, and create your dream jumpsuit customized to your curves. The Mercier is a knit jumpsuit with a wrap top, waist darts for shaping, straight-leg pants with an elasticated back waistband, and short sleeves (or use the sleeves from the Grafton Dress, Top and Skirt Mix & Match Pack). 

And one of our favorite parts? The wrap’s overlayer opens in the front to make the jumpsuit easy to get on and off, while tying securely at the waist when worn. 

Whether sewn up in a soft jersey for an everyday look or in a metallic knit for a dramatic showstopper, the Mercier will take your wardrobe to the next level.

The Mercier comes in sizes 0-32 and cup sizes C-H and is available exclusively to Cashmerette Club members. Not a member yet? Join today for as little as $9 (cancel anytime). Get started at cashmerette.com/club.

With the Mercier Jumpsuit, the Cashmerette Club pattern for October, you can create your dream jumpsuit customized to your curves.

The best part of sewing your own jumpsuit? You can make it fit you exactly like you want. Whether you need to add or remove length from the torso, lengthen or shorten the legs, grade between sizes, or add more room for your tummy or bum, you can customize your Mercier to your unique shape to craft your ideal fit. So long, ill-fitting jumpsuits!

And you can sew your first Mercier with confidence thanks to the free step-by-step video sewalong hosted by Mari of @sew_happy_sewalongs

Sewn in a size 20 G/H in a vibrant pink cotton spandex French terry, Amanda’s Mercier feels like secret pajamas and is the perfect mom-on-the-go outfit this fall. She also added an exterior channel for ties so that she could ruche the sides adding a bit of personality and pizzazz to this magnificent Mercier.

I will be feeling comfortable, fun and put together while chasing around my littles (and sitting in carpool let’s be real) this fall!”

Sound the sewing alarm, it’s a workshop sale! ⏰⏰

It’s our fall workshop sale and now through Monday, October 23, use code SEW20 to save 20% on any of our online workshops, including our already discounted workshop bundles. That adds up to 35% in savings! 

Our workshops bring curvy fitting expert Jenny Rushmore into your sewing space to teach you fitting, pattern hacking, and advanced construction techniques. Stream the video lessons anytime on any device, and watch and rewatch the lessons as many times as you’d like. You can even ask questions right in the lessons, and our knowledgeable team will answer them.

Head to cashmerette.com/workshops to get started.

Michelle is wearing gray Meriam Trousers and a white and black polka top blouse. Michelle has one hand in her pocket and Jenny is leaning on Michelle's shoulder. Over the image in a blue box is the text: Fall Sale: Up to 35% Off Workshops”]

We love a bundle, don’t you? That’s why we created this workshop bundle that will knock your socks off and level up your sewing game. And the best part? Now until October 23 you can get this bundle for 35% off! 🤯

The Master Fit and Pattern Pattern Hacking for Curves Bundle pairs Fitting for Curves (our most popular course!) with the Pattern Hacking for Curves course to help you gain the knowledge and skills to adjust any pattern to fit your body, and then make it your own. 

We created this bundle so that you can tackle any upper body fitting challenge—from FBA to swayback—and then take those perfectly fitting garments and create infinite possibilities through pattern hacking. Perfect for beginners and advanced beginners, you can follow along with Jenny as she demonstrates flat pattern adjustments and hacks from the comfort of your own sewing space. Plus, you’ll receive a coupon code for 30% off any pattern from Cashmerette.

All you have to do is use code SEW20 at check out to get an additional discount on this already-discounted bundle  now through Monday, October 23. Go to cashmerette.com/workshops to get started. 

We can’t wait to see what you make!

Is this the year you sew your first well-fitting button-down shirt? How about your first pair of jeans, or your first swimsuit? 

We want to help you tackle complex projects with ease with our  workshop bundle, Master Advanced Construction—35% off this week only!

This workshop bundle combines our Shirt Making for Curves, Jeans Making for Curves, and Swimsuit Making for Curves online course for the ultimate next-level sewing trifecta. We created this bundle to help you feel prepared to face those more challenging projects you’ve been aspiring to make. Watching Jenny work through each step of the process will show you that there is no magic involved—it’s just sewing! 

Plus, our Shirt Making, Jeans Making, and Swimsuit Making for Curves workshops come with a coupon code for free patterns, which you can use on any of the patterns in our collection.

This bundle is guaranteed to up your sewing game, while boosting your confidence so you can take on any sewing project that catches your eye. Head to cashmerette.com/workshops now through Monday, October 23 and use code SEW20 to get and additional discount on this already-discounted bundle.

👖Dream of wearing beautiful tailored trousers that you sewed yourself?

👖Love the idea of a flex waistband but need additional help sewing it up?

Then the Pants Making for Curves Workshop is for you!

In our newest workshop, Pants Making for Curves, Jenny takes you through the process of sewing a pair of Meriam Trousers, from choosing your size and fabric all the way to the final hem. With step-by-step video lessons and loads of bonus tutorials and tips throughout, you’ll create your perfectly tailored trousers with confidence. Let’s talk about bras.

Do you find it hard to find or make a bra that fits your full bust AND looks gorgeous? 🌟 Are you a bit intimidated by the idea of sewing a bra? 🌟 Do you want to finally make the supportive and beautiful bra of your dreams with help at every step? 🌟

Then the Willowdale Bra Sewalong is just what you’ve been looking for! 🎉🎉

From the comfort of home, join curvy sewing expert Jenny Rushmore of Cashmerette and professional bra pattern drafter Jennifer Fairbanks of Porcelynne as they explain every step of sewing your own Willowdale Bra, from choosing your size all the way to sewing on the bow. With this workshop, sewing your own well-fitting bra has never been easier!

The Willowdale is a full frame underwire bra with a 4-piece cup design for vital support and lift in a beautifully rounded shape. Designed specially for larger busts in band sizes 28-54 and cup sizes C-J—the Willowdale offers over 120 sizes to help you get the perfect fit. 

And now through Monday, October 23, use code SEW20 to save 20% off the Willowdale Bra Sewalong during our fall workshop sale!

Ever the prolific sewist, Kemi made four Merciers!  She made 3 jumpsuits and a wrap dress, all in a size 14 E/F.

For her first jumpsuit she chose a lovely petrol blue rayon/spandex crepe knit. Her second jumpsuit was crafted using a gray and black abstract polyester/spandex knit. Her wrap dress is made with a green polyester/spandex with the Mercier bodice and the Grafton A-line Skirt with mid length sleeves and in-seam pockets. And her fourth and final creation is a jumpsuit made of a stunning color-blocked red and blue polyester ponte. All were sewn up beautifully and she’s received a lot of compliments, especially on the color-blocked jumpsuit.

Overall, she enjoyed the process of crafting her Merciers and loves the results. We have to say, we’re loving the results too!

Bright, bold, and slightly retro, Leah’s Mercier is an orange floral dream. Sewn in a size 8 C/D grading to a 10 at the waist and 6 at the hip, she went with a bold print double brushed poly that shows off the flow of the wide legs while balancing the fitted bodice. A big fan of the support and simplicity of the cross front bodice, she plans on making more Merciers next summer.

Leah’s (@Leah_wink) measurements are 37” high bust, 36.5” full bust, 31” waist, and 38” hips.

Here’s what Leah had to say about her Mercier Jumpsuit:
“I decided to swing big with a bright, bold print for my Mercer. Double brushed poly was the perfect fabric choice for a jumpsuit.  It shows off the flow of the wide legs while providing stretch to balance with a more fitted bodice. I love the slightly-retro vibes my Mercer gives! Plus it’s comfy and easy to wear while looking very put together.

The Mercer pattern is very easy to follow, with a unique waistband and tie front construction that provides stability and support for the full-length legs that could be quite heavy, depending on fabric choice.  I really like the simple cross front of the bodice. I will definitely be making this pattern again, maybe with the Grafton skirt or shorts for next summer.”

The Mercier comes in sizes 0-32 and cup sizes C-H is available exclusively to Cashmerette Club members. Not a member yet? Join today for as little as $9 (cancel anytime). Get started at cashmerette.com/club.

Learning to sew your own clothes can be utterly life changing. 

Forget squeezing into ill-fitting garments which aren’t to your taste, or struggling to find anything in your size—once you can sew, you can make a whole closet of clothes, in any style or fabric, to fit your body.

This is why I wrote my new book, “Sewing the Curve.”

Focused on plus-size beginner sewists, “Sewing the Curve” is a comprehensive guide for learning how to sew complete with free video sewalongs and 6 (six!) brand new patterns in sizes 12 – 32 (UK 16 – 36) and cup sizes C – H, “Sewing the Curve” will teach you how to sew a closet of gorgeous garments on patterns made for bodies just like yours.

Pre-order your copy of “Sewing the Curve” at cashmerette.com/stc.

[Image description: Jenny’s book is propped up on a white table against a white background. Strewn on the table are scissors, paper, and thread.]

When I learned to sew a decade ago, I bought a popular sewing book, along with some fabric, tools, and a sewing machine. And then discovered to my dismay that none of the patterns came in my size, despite the fact I was a totally average size. I ended up making a wrap skirt which would *sort of* fit, though it was definitely not trustworthy on a windy day, and eventually I had to learn how to adjust sewing patterns in order to actually make truly wearable garments.

So I know all too well how disheartening it is to be learning to sew and not have patterns or instructions that actually include you, or to have to do tons of *extra* work to achieve the same result.

Although the overall state of the plus size sewing market has improved radically since then, I realized there still wasn’t a “learn to sew” book out there for plus size people: and thus, “Sewing the Curve” was born!

“Sewing the Curve” is a guide to learning to sew for plus size sewists, and it includes 6 brand-new patterns in sizes 12-32 and cup sizes C-H. Pre-order your copy of “Sewing the Curve” at cashmerette.com/stc.

I’m absolutely giddy about the launch of my newest book, “Sewing the Curve!”

But did you know that this is actually my second book? My first book “Ahead of the Curve” was published in 2021 and has now received over 650 five star ratings on Amazon!

So, what’s the difference between these two books? 🤔 Allow me to explain…

The fundamental difference between “Sewing the Curve” (STC) and “Ahead of the Curve” (AOTC), is that STC is all about learning how to sew, and AOTC is all about learning how to fit.

🧵STC is aimed at plus-sized people who either don’t know how to sew at all yet, or have tried but are still at the beginner stage. If you’re a beginner and need to learn how to sew – then STC is for you!

🧵AOTC is aimed at plus-sized people who already know how to sew, but don’t know how to alter sewing patterns to fit, or aren’t yet feeling confident at that skill. If you know how to sew, and you want to learn how to fit – then AOTC is for you!

“Sewing the Curve” is a guide to learning to sew for plus size sewists, and it includes 6 brand-new patterns in sizes 12-32 and cup sizes C-H. Get your copy of “Sewing the Curve” at cashmerette.com/SewingTheCurve.

One of my favorite patterns featured in my new book “Sewing the Curve” is the Fairfax Jacket. It’s where creativity, fashion, and quilting collide! 💥

The Fairfax Jacket is a loosely fitted, quilted jacket with huge potential for creativity! For a quick and easy sew, it can be made with pre-quilted fabric, or you can make your own out of any woven fabric you like. Get creative with a fun quilted stitching pattern, or even create your own patchwork fabric—the sky is the limit!

With two views to choose from, this pattern will help teach a number of skills also including sewing darts, patch pockets and trying your hand at creating quilted fabric! 

Aside from the Fairfax Jacket, “Sewing the Curve” has 5 other brand new Cashmerette patterns, including a woven swing dress and tunic, a really cool wrap skirt (finally, one I could have fit into!), an awesome t-shirt, snazzy knit pants, and a gorgeous lined sheath dress.

So what can you expect from my new book “Sewing the Curve?” I’m glad you asked! 😉

📖 It’s a comprehensive guide to learning to sew, from choosing the right sewing machine and tools, how to understand sewing patterns and instructions, how to thread and use your machine, and then lots of specific skill building, from sewing seams, to finishing edges and hemming. 

📖 There are video sewalongs available for free to accompany every step of the book—from the skills through to the patterns. If you’re a visual learner or want more of the “why” along with the “how” when you’re learning, these videos will be a big help!

📖 There are SIX brand new patterns included! They are in size 12-32 (UK 16-36) and cup sizes C-H, and they’re available printed (in the back of the paper book) and also as digital PDFs (in print-at-home and A0 copyshop files). 

“Sewing the Curve” will teach you how to sew a closet of gorgeous garments. Beginner-friendly, this book will take you from threading your machine to completing your first garment that fits and expresses your personal style. Pre-order your copy at cashmerette.com/stc.

It’s officially launch day! 🎉🥳

Today is the day that my new book “Sewing the Curve” launches into the wild! 

Thank you SO much to all of you for your pre-orders, it really means the world to me. And if you haven’t already pre-ordered, now you can buy a copy and have it sent directly to your door!

When I learned to sew, I bought a popular sewing book, along with some fabric, tools, and a sewing machine. And then I discovered to my dismay that none of the patterns came in my size, despite the fact I was a totally average clothes size. So I know all too well how disheartening it is to start learning to sew and not have patterns or instructions that actually include you, or to have to do tons of extra work to achieve the same result as someone smaller.

Although the overall state of the plus size sewing market has improved radically since I learned back in 2010, I realized there still wasn’t a “learn to sew” book out there for plus size people, which meant lots of people were still struggling: and thus, “Sewing the Curve” was born!

In “Sewing the Curve”, I teach you everything about you need to know about how to sew clothes from the very basics, like how to choose a sewing machine, how to understand sizing, where to find plus-size friendly patterns, and how to use printed and PDF patterns, through to the five core skills of sewing—and then, how to actually sew your first garments. 

I really hope you love the book as much as I loved writing it—and I can’t wait to see all the photos of you wearing your first me-made garments!

Get your copy at cashmerette.com/stc.

If you’re looking for a beginner pants pattern that is both fashionable and comfy— I mean, we’re talking pajama pants comfy–then the Ardley Pants is the pattern for you.

Featured in my new book “Sewing the Curve” the Ardley Pants are super comfortable, elasticated-waist, straight-leg pants with optional pockets. They’re designed for mid-weight knit fabric, such as rayon ponte or French terry, with at least 20% stretch, but lighter-weight fabric such as bamboo jersey will also work and give a more casual look.

social_posts.post_text:
Sharon (@thesharonsews), a prolific sewist in our community recently knocked our socks off with her #VernonShirt hacks and reminded us of how versatile this classic button-up shirt pattern really is. 

Here are the 4 ways she hacked the Vernon:

1️⃣ Colorblocking: She used two fabrics to create one brilliant colorblocked button-up. The pleat on the back of the shirt was also changed to gathers, and two stacked buttons were used to add to the colorblocked look.

2️⃣ Pintuck and decorative stitches: the sleeve was widened, embellished with pintucks and decorative stitches, and the sleeve cuff changed to elastic. The same pintuck and decorative stitches embellishment technique was used on the back of the yoke.

3️⃣ Patchwork ruffles: The sleeve was widened at the wrist, the sleeve cuff was replaced with elastic, the collar eliminated, and a patchwork ruffle added to the shoulders and collar stand.

4️⃣ Patchwork asymmetrical sleeves: she used quilting cotton to create a patchwork accent on both sleeves.

She sewed each Vernon in a size 10 G/H except for the blue linen one which is a 12 G/H as she was going for an oversized look. 

This definitely got our creative juices flowing! Have you hacked the Vernon to create a new look?

The Vernon comes in sizes 0-32 and cup sizes C-H. Get yours at cashmerette.com/vernon.

#VernonShirt #Cashmerette #CashmerettePatterns #PlusSizeSewing #CurvySewing #ISew #Sewing #HandmadeWardrobe #IndiePatterns #SewistsOfInstagram #SewersOfInstagram #MeMade

And you can mix and match it with the Grafton's bodices and skirts, like we did in this sample!

A modern art quilted jacket inspired by Mondrian marks the most artistic approach to the Fairfax Jacket from Jenny’s new book, “Sewing the Curve” and we can’t get enough! Amanda’s Fairfax sewn in a 16 G/H, is pieced together with pretty printed fabrics collected from her local quilt store and quilted using a combination of walking foot and free motion. The finished product is truly a masterpiece.

Amanda’s (@trashpandafashions) measurements are 41”(104cm) high bust, 45” (114cm) full bust, 37” (94cm) waist, and 40” (101cm) hips.

Amanda shares about her Fairfax Jacket:
“I was inspired by Mondrian to make a modern art inspired quilted jacket. However, my local quilt store has a fantastic offering of pretty printed fabric, and I couldn’t resist mirroring the design to make it reversible.

I pieced together the fabric for each side a little larger than each pattern piece, sewed the bust darts, quilted all the pattern pieces with a combination of walking foot and free motion quilting, cut each pattern piece, and sewed the jacket pieces together. To make it reversible, I flat felled the seams.

It took a bit of extra effort, but I LOVE the result.”

“Sewing the Curve” by Jenny Rushmore is a beginner’s guide to sewing for plus size sewists, and it includes 6 brand-new patterns in sizes 12-32 and cup sizes C-H. Get your copy of “Sewing the Curve” at cashmerette.com/SewingTheCurve.

It has the perfect weight for a casual skirt and I am excited that I can wear it to work in the office. The pattern was so simple to throw together. I am really excited to make this skirt again with an autumnal plaid for the colder months. I think it will look amazing.

And I like the versatility of the Eustis pattern and how I can have a blouse for work, or if I make it with a casual jersey, I can make a classic t-shirt. It’s official: cargo pants are having a renaissance. Traditionally, they were associated with hard and dirty work, made from hard-wearing fabrics and designed for utility. But now they’re also on trend, come in lots more colors and fabrics, and when it comes to the Esmond Pants, this month’s #CashmeretteClub pattern, they also come with all the pocket options you could ever want.

The #EsmondPants feature pocket styles that can be mixed and matched, including: 

👖 Roomy front patch pockets with an angular opening
👖 Pleated pocket with angled flap
👖 Gusseted pocket with squared flap
👖 Back pocket with covered zip
👖 Back pocket with exposed zip

The Esmond comes in sizes 0-32 and is available exclusively to Cashmerette Club members. Not a member yet? Join today for as little as $9 (cancel anytime). Get started at cashmerette.com/club.

Sewn in a blue floral linen viscose, it’s a comfy addition to her summer dress wardrobe, but simply add a cardigan and you’ve got a fall weather wardrobe staple with a stylish touch.

Yvonne (@thewheeliestitcher) sewed her Montvale in a size 18 E/F graded to 28 at the waist and 22 at the hips. Her measurements are 43” high bust, 47" full bust, 48.5” waist, and 51” hips (109 cm HB, 119 cm FB, 123 cm W, 129 cm H).

Yvonne had this to say about her Montvale Dress:
“This was such a quick and easy make due to there being very few pattern pieces. The instructions are really clear and the dress took shape in no time at all. It is so comfortable to wear and perfect for a summer’s day. 

I love it so much I’ll definitely be adding a cardigan so that I can continue wearing it into the autumn.”

Whether you’re going for the utilitarian vibe or a relaxed version with fun colors and fabrics or a combination of the two, the Esmond Pants are the customizable cargo pants sewing pattern designed for curves that you can personalize to perfection.

Traditionally associated with hard and dirty work, made from hard-wearing fabrics and designed for utility, cargo pants are now on trend and come in lots more colors and fabrics! This cargo pants pattern features a relaxed style with straight legs, two bum fit options, and a partially elasticated back waistband for the ultimate curve-friendly fit. And top it off with multiple mix-and-match pocket options and trendy cuffs, plus an optional D-ring detail to take your Esmond’s utilitarian vibe to the next level.

We can’t wait to see what you make with this pattern!

Cheers to a positive new year! 🥂✨

This year we’re focusing on New Year’s Resolutions done right.

I adore a jolt of new energy and the possibility of transformation in January - but I deeply resent the fact that so much of what I'm told I'm meant to care about is changing my body. Making it smaller, if we're going to be specific about it. 

So I’ve decided that I'll make the most of the New Year fervor, but in a way that builds me up, not shrinks me down. I want abundance and joy and more - not less! 

I have a lot of ideas but here is one of my New Year’s resolutions:

✨ Make an achievable sewing plan
For my 2024 sewing year, I'm planning out ideas for the first half of the year, to capture all that new year creative inspiration. I'm going to stick them up on the board in my sewing room but not attach any deadlines - that way it doesn't begin to feel like a chore.

Naturally, I'm using my @mybodymodel croquis, because I find it's really hard to free-sketch garments, and I love being able to see what proportions will look like ON ME - it's a really great trick to avoid spending ages making an outfit you're not so keen on when you try it on. 

And right now there's also a sale at MyBodyModel!

Enter promo code NEWYEAR24 for 24% off any purchase of 1-5 Credits for your own MyBodyModel printable & digital fashion planner, made just for you. 

This discount is valid until 11.59pm EST on Jan 21, so don't miss out!

Check out Lilli’s splendid Honeybourne Dress! 👀 

This was her first make of 2023 and what a way to start a new year of makes! It fits, it’s comfortable and we have to say, it’s absolutely stunning.

#Repost @frocksandfroufrou with @get.repost
・・・
And here is my very first Me Make of 2023! Starting the year off with a bang and a splendid second version of @cashmerette’s divine #honeybournedress. 

This one is made from a tencel linen fabric from @neridahansenfabrics, printed with a @skinnylaminx design, and purchased about half an hour before a “20% off all fabric!” email hit my inbox. (It’s beautiful. I have zero regrets.)

The fabric has a slinky handfeel and more drape than the lovely cotton sateen I made my first Honeybourne from, and the reduced volume in the skirt makes it feel less like a party dress, and more like something REALLY nice that I could wear for day-to-day. 
I made the decision to French-seam the bodice and sleeves, but forgot to cut a wider seam allowance (rookie mistake) so it’s a much firmer fit than my first. I also cut the neckline higher at the front and lower at the back, and inserted pockets into the sides of the skirt using the tutorial from the Cashmerette blog. 

I fully intended to try an invisible zipper, but by that point in the proceedings it was clear that I was going to have to use every millimetre of fabric I had if I intended to breathe while wearing the dress. 

The zipper insertion still isn’t perfect (one side of the fastening absolutely insisted on being slightly higher than the other) but I’m definitely improving. 

The resulting dress fits like a proverbial glove, and despot my misgivings, is comfortable (even if I wouldn’t want to wear it to a twelve course degustation meal haha).

How are your New Year’s resolutions coming along? However they’re coming I hope that you’re enjoying this current season of planning, creating and resolving. 

Still looking for some ideas? How about… 

❤️ Use your precious fabric or yarn on a 'tried and true' pattern.
I find there's nothing quite like moving a beautiful fabric from my stash onto my body - but I sometimes stall out with indecision and the fear of not wanting to ruin it. That's where my trusty "tried and true" patterns come into play - I know they'll work, and I'll end up with a garment I love in a fabric I love. 

❤️ If your body is changing, plan strategically! The reality is most of our bodies vary a lot, whether that's hour to hour or year to year. But that doesn't mean you have to stop creating. 

And don't forget our New Year Sale is on right NOW through January 21 - that’s tomorrow! Use code NEW24 at checkout to get 24% off your MyBodyModel credits.

P.S. Are you a Cashmerette Club Member? Then you ALWAYS get a discount! Just go to your Club Dashboard, click on "perks" and you'll find more info there

Or head to mybodymodel.com to get started.

Wishing you lots of fun designing and visualizing your best year ever, in a way that celebrates & honors YOU and your one-and-only body ❤
